info.headline: Weather Advisory# 3 FINAL as of 11 AM, Jan. 29, 2018For Tail-End of A Cold Front
info.description:
Weather Advisory# 3 FINAL as of 11 AM, Jan. 29, 2018
For Tail-End of A Cold Front 

The effect of the Tail-End of A Cold Front has weakened. Improved weather conditions will be experienced over Nome. However, isolated rain showers or thunderstorms, especially during the afternoon or evening, should be expected in these areas due to the west.

With this development, this is the final advisory for this weather system.

en.name: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies
en.attributionMessage: Key Messages from International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies

en.title: Key Messages for Extreme Cold
en.description: These are actions to take to reduce risk and protect you and your household from extreme cold.

mitigation: Know your area's risks for extreme weather conditions
Know your nearest points of medical support
Prepare your home. Check on pipes and have safe heating sources.
Prepare your vehicle with necessary emergency items and fuel
seasonalForecast: Prepare your home. Check on pipes and have safe heating sources.
Prepare your vehicle with necessary emergency items and fuel
Check on neighbors, friends, and those at risk
warning: Protect your home. Check on pipes and use heating sources safely
Protect yourself with warm clothing and cover exposed skin
Be aware and cautious of icy conditions, especially while driving
Check on neighbors, friends, and those at risk
watch: Protect your home. Check on pipes and use heating sources safely.
Protect yourself with warm clothing and cover exposed skin
Be aware and cautious of icy conditions, especially while driving
Check on neighbors, friends, and those at risk
immediate: Protect your home. Check on pipes and use heating sources safely
Be aware and cautious of icy conditions, especially while driving
Know and watch for signs of hypothermia and frostbite
Check on neighbors, friends, and those at risk
recover: Be aware and cautious of icy conditions, especially while driving
Be aware of flooding caused by snow melting
